name: pREST
description: pREST is a fast RESTful server that gives you âš¡ instant, realtime, high-performance on any Postgres application, existing or new.

PREST_JWT_DEFAULT.description: Activates or deactivates JSON Web Tokens (JWT) authentication

PREST_JWT_WHITELIST.description: Serves to configure which endpoints will not ask for jwt token

PREST_AUTH_ENABLED.description: Activates or deactivates token generation endpoint support

PREST_AUTH_TYPE.description: Type that will receive the login, support for body and http basic authentication

PREST_AUTH_ENCRYPT.description: Type of encryption used in password field, support for MD5 and SHA1

PREST_AUTH_USERNAME.description: User field that will be consulted - if your software uses email just abstract name username (at pREST code level it was necessary to define an internal standard)

PREST_AUTH_PASSWORD.description: Password field that will be consulted

PREST_SSL_CERT.description: Name of the client SSL certificate (see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNECT-SSLCERT)

PREST_SSL_KEY.description: Specifies the location for the secret key used for the client certificate (see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNECT-SSLKEY)

PREST_SSL_ROOTCERT.description: Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s) (see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNECT-SSLROOTCERT)
